document_data.name: Galileus
document_data.mainbody: '''Galileus''' was an [[astrology|astrologer]] and [[diviner]] who performed his work on the [[Sword Coast]] in the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Description: As could be expected, Galileus spoke in generalities and offered vague predictions to those who asked. He often got a crick in his neck from starting up at the skies for so long.
document_data.Activities: Galileus spent his time studying heavenly bodies, gathering raw data from their positions, and making predictions based on that information.
document_data.History: At some point in the {{YearlinkName|1368}}, he was seen passing by the town of [[Beregost]].
